newsitem.title: USA: Tisch firm lifts Gunther stake to 14.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Tisch firm lifts Gunther stake to 14.6 pct.

text.p: Four Partners, a New York partnership controlled by sons of Loews Corp co-chairman Laurence Tisch, said Thursday it raised its stake in Gunther International Ltd to the equivalent of 649,189 common shares or 14.6 percent of the total outstanding.
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the partnership said that on September 26 it bought in a privately negotiated deal 64,286 additional shares of Gunther at $3.50 a share.
The partnership said it holds the stake in Gunther for investment purposes. The stake includes 494,189 common shares amd 155,000 additional shares issuable upon exercise of warrants at $6.00 a share.

The Tisch brothers who control the partnership are, Andrew Tisch, chairman of the management committee, Loews Corp; Daniel Tisch, general partner, Mentor Partners L.P.; James Tisch, president, Loews; and Thomas Tisch, managing partner, FLF Associates.
Gunther is a Norwich, Conn., maker of high speed mailing machines.
